resources.string: Something has gone bad while interpreting the book. If you\'re the book\'s creator, check your syntax.
Oops, something\'s gone wrong while executing the book. If you\'re the book\'s creator, check your code.
Oops, something\'s gone wrong while loading the book. If you\'re the book\'s creator, check your files.
Something has gone wrong while executing the book :/
Your story\'s narrative & speech go here
Pick a working title for your new book
Unknown exception occurred while reading from or writing to file
Something unexpected happened during preprocessing source files. If you\'re developing the book, check if all included files are present.
Pick a unique name which you can easily associate with this question. You will use this name to refer to this question later. What is this question about?
Create a new condition. Pick a variable, operator and either variable or value to which it should be equal, unequal, less or greater than
Add a scene before this one
Jump to label after this scene
Add custom statement before this scene
Mark this statement with a label, so you can jump to it later. Pick a name for the new label:
After this scene, move to the scene which is marked by label. Combine this with conditions (branches) to create conditional jumps which allow you to jump around the story. Enter label to jump to:
Add a custom statement which will be inserted before this scene with same indentation. Preceding colon will be automatically added. Remember to follow the syntactic rules!
Set an existing, or add a new variable. Values can be strings, numbers and basic operations on them. For concatenating strings, use + operator.
You have some unsaved changes. If you exit now, you will lose them. Are you sure?
This is an INPUT line; user\'s input is stored in variable %s
This statement terminates the current chapter
No variable for the question has been chosen. Randomly assigned variable is %s. You can change this by restarting the scene.

Create an input dialog. When your story reaches this line, user will be asked to enter some text which will be stored to a variable. This will replace the current line. Enter variable name and hint to the user:
e.g. Enter your favourite color, such as purple
This app needs storage permission in order to load books from storage. Please allow the app to use local storage.
Are you sure you want to permanently remove this book from your device? This action is non-reversible.
Error: 400 Bad request. Please report this.
200 OK, everything seems OK. Please tell me if you ever see this.
201 Created, everything seems OK. Please tell me if you ever see this.
Error: 404 Not found. Please report this.
Error: 500 Server error. Please report this.
Something has gone really wrong. You shouldn\'t see this, but if you do, please tell me.
Username or password don\'t match. Please check, then try again
You aren\'t trying to do something you know you can\'t, are you? If you don\'t know what\'s going on, please report this.
Server is reporting an unknown error. Please report this.
Server says it can\'t find what I am looking for, which is weird. Please report this.
Server complains about a duplicate. If you don\'t know what\'s going on, please report this.
Server says it can\'t understand me, which is weird. Please report this.
Server is drunk (or I messed up something badly). Please report this.
That means you won\'t see any new changes, though you can still browse any data you have already seen
This means you won\'t be able to add new stuff or refresh until you reconnect
Something is wrong with the network, or the server is unavailable. Please report this.
I\'m having some troubles with files… Please report this.
Something is wrong with the files or the network. Please report this.
You cannot make any changes while you\'re offline (for now).
Something has gone very wrong. Please report this.
Seems like things are slow or overloaded at my end, sorry about that. Please try again later.
It seems that you\'re making too many requests to server. Try again in a minute
That\'s a server error, sorry. It will be fixed soon.
202, Accepted, everything seems OK (at least partially). Please tell me if you see this.
…and I\'m not sure what. If you could pass me this: \"%s\" I\'d be grateful
Server says you don\'t have the permission to do that
Server is down for planned maintenance. Please try again later.
Server is unreachable at the moment. If the problem persists, please report it.
It seems that you\'re trying to send a too large file. Try with something smaller.
By registering for an account, I agree to the Terms of Service and Privacy Policy
This isn\'t a valid email address
And I don\'t know what. Please try again and report this.
Password is too short. Please use at least %1$d characters
Password is too long. Please use at most %d characters.
Username is too long. Please use at most %d characters.
There is already an account with that email
That username is already taken, please pick another one
Allow others to edit and republish this book?
Try to be more specific when picking genres; leave out the ones which aren\'t truly fitting and try again
Entered text is too long; try again with something shorter
Enter a part of or whole book title
Something unexpected has occured while executing your request. Sorry about that.
It seems I can\'t locate your file. Please report this.
Pick a short description for the chapter
Pick a new title for your chapter
Are you sure you want to remove the chapter permanently? This action is non-reversible.
This code contains errors. Are you sure you want to save?
You have some unsaved changes. Do you want to save them before exiting?
You have some unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to exit?
This is your first book. Congrats!
I hope you don\'t mind me showing you around. You can always turn this off in settings (but it won\'t show more than once anyway).
Look, you\'ve got a book! Go ahead, tap on it
This is your library. You can play books from here as usual, but long-tapping them brings some additional (and interesting!) options.
Wait, we\'re not done with this one yet! Most of the things here can be long-tapped. Go ahead, long tap on the book and copy it to your library
For example, try to long tap this and select \"Edit book\"
In this tab, there are books you can download. When you spot something interesting, tap on it to display more info.
This is the internal structure of your book - each item here represents one chapter
You can add more chapters using this button
But first, let\'s edit an existing one. Just tap on it!
Now that you\'re here again, let me show you one more thing. Long tap this and select \"Edit code\"
This is what these books are really made of - code. If you don\'t really care about this stuff, now\'s the right time to tap on "Skip" and use the back button to exit.
But if you\'re a programmer, this should ring some bells. And If not, this could be the opportunity to think about becoming one!
Nothing starting with a colon is actually displayed to the user. You can do calculations here, so e.g. :a=3+2 would put a value of 5 into variable a
You can use this to present a question to the user. The thing in square brackets is a variable - that\'s how we will call this question from now on.
These are the possible answers to the question. The thing inside square brackets is, you guessed it, a variable. Afterwards, if question equals some answer, it means that answer was selected.

We use this to check whether stuff is (or isn\'t) equal. So, for example code following :a=5?, or :question=answer?, would get executed (i.e. shown) if a equals to 5 (or, answer was selected for a question).
This is a jump. It \'jumps\' the execution to the specified label - that\'s a special statement beginning and ending with a colon (\':\'), so everything continues from there on.
To ask user for input (like I asked for your name at the beginning, remember?), start your line with a variable name in square brackets. Input will then be saved in that variable.

Comments are things left by humans, for humans, and are ignored by the book. The visual editor you\'ve used before doesn\'t care about them, so it discards them. But, you didn\'t edit this chapter in that way, so I\'ve left you some helpful ones to serve as reminders.
When book reaches two semicolons, it halts, no questions asked. Be sure to use this inside some if-block, i.e. after checking for some condition!
But all talk no do is not fun at all. Now go ahead, take a look at everything, make mistakes and have fun coding!\nP.S. Lines are colored differently depending on their type; take that as a hint!
The red line means you got a mistake there. Now, I\'m sure you only haven\'t finished typing, so go on!
You can advance the story by tapping anywhere
This is your first choice - what you tap now could impact the future storyline!
This is a story editor - here you can easily create new and edit existing stories.
You can change who says what…
If this icon is red, it means this doesn\'t get executed always, that is, there\'s a condition under which this is displayed to the user. Let\'s see what it is, tap on it!
These need to be fulfilled in order to show this to the user. There\'s only one condition now, and it\'s obviously false - zero will never be equal to one!
Good, now that we\'ve removed it, you can close this and watch it turn black.
Let\'s see what else is there. Tap the arrow to go to the next scene.
Oops, it seems that we\'ve reached the end
After this, story jumps to a label called \"far away\". Want to know where it is?
Use the back arrow! You\'ll know what you\'re looking for when you find it ;)
Hmm, where could the code be? Ah, right
Finally, you have found it! You can delete it, delete and replace it with another, or just memorize it and brag to your friends - your choice
It seems that our journey is coming to an end. Feel free to explore, edit and create whatever your heart thinks of. And let me just show you a few more things
You can delete scenes using this button
Or make your own questions here
But whatever, you do, don\'t forget to save at the end. Happy creating!
I hope writing is going well! Remember, when you feel like you\'ve finished, you can long tap your book and select \"Publish\" to make it available for everyone
Tell us how much you\'ve liked this book, on a scale from 1 to 5
It seems you haven\'t finished the demo. When you\'re ready to continue, just tap the book to move on
These are the more advanced operations you can perform from here
You can use this button to set an existing variable to a certain value
Use this to show the dialog box to the user and ask for input in this scene
This adds the label here, so you can jump to this scene afterwards
And this jumps to a label you set using the previous button. You can jump both forwards and backwards.
And if it\'s still not enough, and you know what you\'re doing, you can add a custom statement here. Be careful, this one can break things!
It seems the demo has come to an end. Your turn!
You can create an account and log in using the button up here, which opens up some additional posibilities such as saving your reading history and allowing you to publish your own books
You might still get these showcases now and then, when you reach into some new uncharted territories. So go ahead, poke around and tap all the buttons you can find. Happy exploring!
Recommendations for people to contact based on your message history

When you feel like you\'re ready, you can write your own story. Remember, no need to stick to a pattern - it can be a narrative, monologue, complex drama, hackable game or a conversational interface of your choice (yes, even a calculator). Go ahead and experiment!
You have already published this book. Are you sure you want to publish another copy?
